alert.note: Alert for Larimer (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 30 at 1:01PM MDT until June 30 at 2:15PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected in the Cameron Peak Burn Scar. * WHERE...A portion of north central Colorado, including the following county, Larimer. * WHEN...Until 330 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding along Manhattan Creek is possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 101 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cameron Peak Burn Scar and Red Feather Lakes. - This includes the following additional locations... Pingree Hill, Goodell Corner and Bellaire Lake.
info.instruction: Be aware of flooding and debris flows while in the Cameron Peak Burn scar.
